 17  ''' 
 18  Constraint Module 
 19   
 20  Individual constraint classes and related functions 
 21   
 22  You can instantiate a PyMoBu constraint passing a MotionBuilder 
 23  constraint into one of the specific constraint classes. 
 24   
 25  You can also create a specific constraint through either the class's 
 26  'Create' method or through the CreateConstraint function. 
 27  ''' 
 28  from pyfbsdk import FBConstraintManager 
 29  from pyfbsdk import FBSystem 
 30  from pyfbsdk import FBConstraint 
 31   
 32  from pymobu.components import PMBBox 
 33   
 34  # create a dictionary of constraint name / indices 
 35  kConstraintTypes = dict((FBConstraintManager().TypeGetName(i), i) for i in xrange(FBConstraintManager().TypeGetCount())) 

 36   
 37  # ----------------------------------------------------- 
 38  # Constraint Utility Functions 
 39  # ----------------------------------------------------- 
 40 -def GetConstraintByName(name, includeNamespace=True): 

 41      '''Returns a constraint that matches it's long name''' 
 42      for const in FBSystem().Scene.Constraints: 
 43          if includeNamespace: 
 44              constraintName = const.LongName 
 45          else: 
 46              constraintName = const.Name  
 47          if name == constraintName: 
 48              return ConvertToPMBConstraint(const) 

 49   

 50 -def GetConstraintsByType(type): 

 51      '''Returns a list of constraints that are of a given type (Aim, Position, ect)''' 
 52      ret = [] 
 53      for constraint in FBSystem().Scene.Constraints: 
 54          if not isinstance(constraint, PMBConstraint): 
 55              classType = getattr(kConstraintClassDict.get(constraint.Description), 'constraintType') 
 56          else: 
 57              classType = getattr(constraint, 'constraintType') 
 58          if classType == type: 
 59              ret.append(ConvertToPMBConstraint(constraint)) 
 60      return ret 

 61   

 62 -def GetCharacterByName(name): 

 63      '''Finds a character with the same long name and returns it''' 
 64      for char in FBSystem().Scene.Characters: 
 65          if name == char.LongName: 
 66              return ConvertToPMBConstraint(char) 

 67   

 68 -def CreateConstraint(type, name=None): 

 69      ''' 
 70      Create a constraint with the given type and optionally with a name 
 71      @param type: name of constraint type found in kConstraintTypes 
 72      @param name: name to give constraint. Default is used if None  
 73      ''' 
 74      try: 
 75          constraint = FBConstraintManager().TypeCreateConstraint(kConstraintTypes[type])                
 76      except KeyError: 
 77          raise Exception("Invalid constraint type '%s'" % type) 
 78       
 79      FBSystem().Scene.Constraints.append(constraint) 
 80       
 81      if name: 
 82          constraint.Name = name 
 83       
 84      return ConvertToPMBConstraint(constraint) 

 85   

 86 -def ConvertToPMBConstraint(constraint): 

 87      '''Converts the given constraint to a PyMoBu constraint type based on constraint description''' 
 88      if isinstance(constraint, PMBConstraint): 
 89          return constraint 
 90      elif isinstance(constraint, FBConstraint): 
 91          try: 
 92              constClass = kConstraintClassDict[constraint.Description] 
 93              return constClass(constraint) 
 94          except KeyError: 
 95              #logger.warning("Not Implemented: Unable to convert constraint '%s'. No PyMoBu class available" % constraint.LongName) 
 96              return constraint 
 97      else: 
 98          raise TypeError("Object is not an instance of FBConstraint. Got '%s' instead." % constraint.__class__.__name__) 

 99   
100  FBConstraint.ConvertToPyMoBu = ConvertToPMBConstraint 

101

133 -def _RefFuncIndexWrapper(func, idx): 

134      '''Wraps another function that uses reference indices and returns that function''' 
135      def _wrappedFunc(self, *args, **kwargs): 
136          return func(self, idx=idx, *args, **kwargs) 

137      return _wrappedFunc 
138   

139 -def _GetSingleRef(self, idx): 

140      '''Returns a single object in the constraint''' 
141      return self.component.ReferenceGet(idx) 

142       

143 -def _SetSingleRef(self, model, idx): 

144      '''Sets the constrained object, either by name or model object''' 
145      _RemoveSingleRef(self, idx) 
146      model = getattr(model, 'component', model) 
147      self.component.ReferenceAdd(idx, model) 

148       

149 -def _RemoveSingleRef(self, idx): 

150      '''Removes the constrained object from the constraint''' 
151      while self.component.ReferenceGetCount(idx): 
152          constrained = _GetSingleRef(self, idx) 
153          self.component.ReferenceRemove(idx, constrained) 

154           

155 -def _GetMultiRef(self, idx): 

156      '''Returns a list of objects in the constraint''' 
157      return [self.component.ReferenceGet(idx, i) for i in xrange(self.component.ReferenceGetCount(idx))] 

158       

159 -def _AddMultiRef(self, models, idx): 

160      '''Adds multiple objects to the constraint''' 
161      if not hasattr(models, "__iter__"): 
162          models = [models] 
163       
164      for m in models: 
165          m = getattr(m, 'component', m) 
166          self.component.ReferenceAdd(idx, m) 

167       

168 -def _RemoveMultiRef(self, models, idx): 

169      '''Removes the given objects from the constraint''' 
170      if not hasattr(models, "__iter__"): 
171          models = [models] 
172   
173      for m in models: 
174          m = getattr(m, 'component', m) 
175          self.component.ReferenceRemove(idx, m)

212 -    def GetSlots(self, returnNames=False): 

213          ''' 
214          Returns list of character mapping slots 
215          @param returnNames: True/False to return the character slot name, otherwise the property object is returned''' 
216          slots = self.ListProperties(pattern='*Link', type='Object') 
217           
218          if returnNames: 
219              return map(lambda x: x.GetName(), slots) 
220          else: 
221              return slots

223 -    def ExportMapping(self, filePath, stripPrefix=None): 

224          ''' 
225          Saves the character map as a template for later use 
226          @param filePath: file to store the mapping 
227          @param stripPrefix: remove a prefix from the model name   
228          ''' 
229          import cPickle as pickle 
230           
231          mapping = self.GetCharacterMapping(True, False, stripPrefix) 
232           
233          dumpFile = file(filePath, "w") 
234          pickle.dump(mapping, dumpFile, 0) 
235          dumpFile.close() 

236           

237 -    def ImportMapping(self, filePath, addPrefix=None, haltOnError=True): 

238          ''' 
239          Applies a character template to the character 
240          @param filePath: mapping file to import 
241          @param addPrefix: append a prefix onto the model names 
242          @param haltOnError: True/False if to raise an exception if a slot or model is not found, otherwise continue 
243          ''' 
244          import cPickle as pickle 
245           
246          with file(filePath) as pickleFile: 
247              dumpData = pickle.load(pickleFile) 
248           
249          for slot, model in dumpData.iteritems(): 
250              if model and addPrefix: 
251                  model = addPrefix + model 
252              try: 
253                  self.SetSlotModel(slot, model) 
254              except: 
255                  if haltOnError: 
256                      raise 

257       

258 -    def GetSlotModel(self, slot): 

259          '''Gets the model that is assigned to the given character slot''' 
260          try: 
261              return self.component.PropertyList.Find(slot)[0] 
262          except IndexError: 
263              return None 

264       

265 -    def RemoveSlotModel(self, slot): 

266          '''Removes the model from the given slot''' 
267          self.SetSlotModel(slot, None) 

268           

269 -    def SetSlotModel(self, slot, model): 

270          ''' 
271          Adds a model to a slot in the characterization map 
272          @param slot: full name of character slot 
273          @param model: model to add to the slot (can be name or model object) 
274          ''' 
275          from pyfbsdk import FBFindModelByName 
276          if isinstance(model, basestring): 
277              obj = FBFindModelByName(model) 
278              if not obj: 
279                  raise Exception("Object '%s' does not exist. Unable to add it to character map '%s' under slot '%s'" % (model, self, slot)) 
280          else: 
281              obj = getattr(model, 'component', model) 
282                    
283          # get the character slot 
284          charSlot = self.ListProperties(pattern=slot) 
285          if not charSlot: 
286              raise Exception("Invalid character slot '%s'" % slot) 
287          # remove all current models from the slot 
288          charSlot[0].removeAll() 
289           
290          if obj: 
291              charSlot[0].append(obj) 

292       

293 -    def GetCharacterMapping(self, returnNames=True, skipEmpty=True, stripPrefix=None): 

294          ''' 
295          Returns a dictionary of slot / model in the character mapping 
296          @param returnNames: return names as strings rather than FBModel objects 
297          @param skipEmpty: skip over slots that are empty 
298          @param stripPrefix: remove a prefix from name of the model   
299          ''' 
300          charSlots = self.GetSlots() 
301                   
302          mapping = {} 
303          for slot in charSlots: 
304              if not len(slot): 
305                  if skipEmpty: 
306                      continue 
307                  else: 
308                      model = None 
309              else: 
310                  model = slot[0] 
311               
312              if returnNames: 
313                  slot = slot.GetName() 
314                  if model: 
315                      model = model.LongName 
316                      if stripPrefix: 
317                          model = model.replace(stripPrefix, "") 
318               
319              mapping[slot] = model 
320           
321          return mapping

884 -    def GetBoxByName(self, name): 

885          ''' 
886          Find a box with a specific name (Name at the top of function box). 
887          Uses component name if the box is an object in the scene otherwise 
888          it will use the box name 
889          ''' 
890          for relBox in self.component.Boxes: 
891              # get the true box to get the name 
892              box = getattr(relBox, 'Box', relBox) 
893              if box.LongName == name: 
894                  return relBox
